text:
I think I have finally, after 1.5months or something, decided what programming languages I like to use and what I want out of them.
<https://github.com/caseykneale/PickingALanguage2020/blob/main/fieldnotes/analysis/readme.md>

elements.text: I think I have finally, after 1.5months or something, decided what programming languages I like to use and what I want out of them.

text: I looked it through. I find it interesting that you find Julia and Rust to be rather close to each other. I don’t know almost any Rust, but I would expect that it’s quite far from Julia?

elements.text: I looked it through. I find it interesting that you find Julia and Rust to be rather close to each other. I don’t know almost any Rust, but I would expect that it’s quite far from Julia?

text: I would like some further clarification to this: “Julia being a LISP is close to haskell.”

elements.text: I would like some further clarification to this: “Julia being a LISP is close to haskell.”

text: Have I accidentally learned a LISP?

elements.text: Have I accidentally learned a LISP?

text: the only major reason some people don't consider julia a LISP is because its surface syntax is not the same form as it's raw expression syntax

elements.text: the only major reason some people don't consider julia a LISP is because its surface syntax is not the same form as it's raw expression syntax
